newsitem.title: USA: NTN says $140mln GTECH deal extended.
newsitem.headline: NTN says $140mln GTECH deal extended.

text.p: NTN Communications Inc said Monday the letter of intent to merge the company with GTECH Holdings Corp's subsidiary GameScape Inc has been extended to August 15.

The deal, first announced June 18, calls for GTECH to buy NTN for about $140 million. GTECH of West Greenwich, R.I., said it would pay $5.125 a share for the company and the difference between $5.125 and NTN's outstanding warrants and options.
NTN Monday reported a $2.2 million net loss for the quarter ended June 30, or a $0.10 a share loss, compared with a net gain of $650,000, or a $0.03 gain per share.

The 1996 quarter included a $1.9 million gain, or $0.08 a share, from discontinued operations. NTN posted an operating loss of $2.1 million for the quarter, compared with an $1.2 million operating loss last year.
The interactive entertainment provider's revenues dropped to $6.3 million in the quarter from 7.2 million last year.

Revenues from network services were about flat at $5.1 million for the quarter, while equipment sales, license and royalty fee income plummeted to $40,000 from $1.0 million. The company's internet revenues increased 40 percent to $627,000 from $449,000.
The company attributed the 1997 results to heavy first-quarter disconnects and a lower pricing strategy implemented for its network customers.
The company's stock closed at 4 Friday.
